alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Mercer; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Warren, southwestern Mercer, southeastern Henderson, northeastern Henry, Des Moines and southern Louisa Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morning Sun, or 11 miles southwest of Wapello, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mediapolis around 1200 AM CDT. Oakville around 1205 AM CDT. Oquawka around 1210 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Biggsville, Gladstone and Rozetta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern and west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.
